description: Students explore public health challenges from multiple lenses through literature and case studies designed to integrate and enhance individual skills and vocational interests. Working in interdisciplinary teams, students articulate questions and develop research and response proposals based on literature, data at hand and the skills acquired from prior courses including the OLE Core. Integrating viewpoints, assessment modalities and communication within the team and with external audiences are emphasized. Local and global issues are included. Counts toward public health studies concentration. Prerequisites: Junior or senior classification, declared public health studies concentration, or permission of instructor.
name: Case Studies in Public Health
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Junior or senior classification, declared public health studies concentration, or permission of instructor.
